verses.roman:
mithilāyām upavane
visṛjya patitaṁ hayam
padbhyām adhāvat santrastaḥ
kṛṣṇo 'py anvadravad ruṣā

synonyms: mithilāyām—at Mithilā; upavane—in a suburban garden; visṛjya—abandoning; patitam—fallen; hayam—his horse; padbhyām—on foot; adhāvat—he ran; santrastaḥ—terrified; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; api—also; anvadravat—ran after; ruṣā—furiously.
translation: In a garden on the outskirts of Mithilā, the horse Śatadhanvā was riding collapsed. Terrified, he abandoned the horse and began to flee on foot, with Kṛṣṇa in angry pursuit.
